AMECard.Name: Shot Boundary Detection
AMECard.Definition: Detection of cuts and transitions inserted during the editing process. The result is the set of shots (i.e., continuously recorded segments) that constitute the video segment.

Input.Name: TypesOfTransitions
Input.Definition: List of transitions types to be detected

Input.Name: Sensitivity
Input.Definition: A 0 to 1 parameter specifying the (normalised) sensitivity

Input.Name: MinimumShotLength
Input.Definition: The minimum shot length to be considered between two detected transitions

Input.Name: MaximumShotLength
Input.Definition: The maximum shot length to be considered between two detected transitions. If a shot transition is forced by maximum shot length the corresponding transition type should be set do a distinct value (e.g., maxShotLen)

Input.Name: MaximumGradualTranistiontLength
Input.Definition: The maximum shot length to be considered valid for a gradual transition

Output.Name: ShotBoundaryTimesAndClassification
Output.Comment: For each shot included in the temporal decomposition of the analysed content a classification label shall be attached specifying the transition type corresponding to the shot start
